website_summaries.verdict: This field guide includes pictures, detailed descriptions, and identifying characteristics of more than 160 reptile and amphibian species in North America.
pros: More than 600 full-color identification photos organized for quick access
Includes detailed information about how reptiles and amphibians eat and move
Also explains anatomy, physiology, evolution, habitats, metamorphosis, and vocalizations
Practical tips for responsible field study or pet care
cons: A bit of page flipping between identification photos and detailed information about the animal

customer_reviews.title: Fails compared to other guides that are available.
customer_reviews.text: This book uses pictures that aren't often indicative of the animals it's reprensenting. They are using odd color morphs and not the more commonly seen animals, making things difficult. The range maps are nearly useless. The descriptions of the animals are far too vague to make this book useful. The Peterson guide is far superior for the same price. Other than that nearly every state has it's own regional guides if you need an even better resource for your area. I'm an avid fieldherper and abandoned this guide many years ago in favor of the myriad guides that surpass this one's usefulness. Bottom line get the Peterson's guide or a regional guide over this confusing mess.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Michels

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice color pictures and great descriptions. The only thing is you have to flip 100's of pages away to get the description to match the picture. Very difficult to use in my opinion. Great for sitting and reading through when bored, but not that great for field use. I am used to guides that have images on one page and the description either on the same page or next page so there is no fumbling around.
customer_reviews.author: TTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great book, PERFECT size!
customer_reviews.text: This book is perfect for my daughter to carry around and identify all the creatures around her. She loves it and I do too. Love that the cover is a leather-type material. Not cardboard or paper. Great resource.
customer_reviews.author: LTRUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: Missing trees?
customer_reviews.text: Unless I’m losing my memory, Hollywood juniper and Italian cypress are no longer in this guide. It makes me think, have they removed other iconic trees from Southern California? I know they were listed once but they are not listed in this 2005 edition. Trees should be planted and watered, not cut down despite being alive and well.
customer_reviews.author: Elmer

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: We love this book and it has helped us identify many species native to our area. Our reptile/amphibian population is diverse and it's fun to try and identify them.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Reptiles and Amphibians
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the National Audubon Society collection . This particular book gave me all kinds of information I needed. The photos are exceptional and the descriptive writing is also easily understood. I will have a greater knowledge of the different species of reptiles and Amphibians and continue to use as a reference to any further questions I may have. I also will enjoy sharing this book with my family and friends in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mersereau

customer_reviews.title: Good field guide.
customer_reviews.text: After finding a very large snake in my garden, I needed to know what species it was but did not have a reference book so I ordered the National Audubon Society Field Guide. It's a great reference book and I will use it often.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G Steenport

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous guides for the price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, compréhensive, great pics. Organization is a bit confusing at first
customer_reviews.author: Walid

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Bought a few of these books as a gift for my husband. He loved them. I really like the colored leather covers, I actually have them up on display.
customer_reviews.author: Baylee S.

customer_reviews.title: Thorough field guide.
customer_reviews.text: These field guides are excellent. Pretty thorough despite being post-sized.
customer_reviews.author: Franco

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. Full color pictures, updated information. For reptile enthusiasts, this is a book you have to have
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book for research
customer_reviews.text: Great book for anyone interested in reptiles and amphibians. All National Audubon books are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great photography
customer_reviews.text: This was a purchase for my husband. We had seen a large snake and we were trying to identify it. Wonderful photographs which he enjoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Gail Rogers

customer_reviews.title: This is great!
customer_reviews.text: This book is wonderful for people learning about reptiles and amphibians. It's extremely informative, although, I'm not seeing any pythons included. Other than that, the pictures are very clear and the text is easy to read for all ages. It is well organized and I definitely recommend buying one :D
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Birch

customer_reviews.title: Useful field guide
customer_reviews.text: Useful field guide, jam-packed with information to allow you to identify those frogs and snakes and such you find while outside.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: It will do.
customer_reviews.text: This guide is rather confusing at times. I like that the authors use general symbols for quick identification but it certainly doesn't do morphs or anuran calls justice. I would recommend learning your anurans using material created by Lang Elliot. Not sure what to do on the rest. Maybe just muscle through this bad boy. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Javamon86

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended for Teachers,  Parents,  Naturalists Enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific guide to amphibians! Great for my kids to take with us outside as we explore all the various local lizards and frogs. Begins with anatomy drawings followed up by photos. Then a report of the description, breeding, habitat, and range of the animal with a map of where in the US it lives. Would highly recommend this book to friends who are naturalist enthusiasts.
customer_reviews.author: Liz Parr

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pictures and descriptions were in different sections. A bit odd.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: great pocket guide
customer_reviews.text: i enjoy carrying these things with me when I am out hiking in the desert and desert mountains. they are small and colorful, easy to follow and well written/orgainzed. I recommed any of the field guides by the Autubon Society for the outdoor-types who like to know what they are seeing when out walking around and exploring.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greff

customer_reviews.title: I love my Audobon Guides
customer_reviews.text: I love my Audobon Guides. I always stash them in my bag when I go for a hike and they look great next to one another on the shelf. This reptile guide isn't as useful as say, an insect guide or bird guide, but I do crack it open every now and then.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Hillstrom

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to ID critters in our yard. Easy to use!

customer_reviews.title: it was a useful book for the class
customer_reviews.text: I grabbed this book for class and, although I didn't use it a whole lot, it was a useful book for the class.

customer_reviews.title: A good field guide
customer_reviews.text: A good field guide. Not the best, but gets the job done

customer_reviews.title: Great Field Guides
customer_reviews.text: I love these field guides. They are compact, full of information, contain high quality photos of each entry to make identification unmistakable, and contain every reptile I have ever needed to look up. These may be the best field guides out there.

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Also another great book.. Great information and pictures for the Reptiles and Amphibians in the book.

customer_reviews.title: My Little Scientist loves it
customer_reviews.text: My son, who is very much into biology and science, and an excellent reader, loved this book at age nine. Reading level is more aimed at an adult audience. Pictures are clear and interesting, well illustrating text.

customer_reviews.title: This one is great and covers alot of species
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a field guide in a smaller format size. This one is great and covers alot of species.

customer_reviews.title: Best field guides
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for grandsons for xmas, they are very into all the creepy crawly things. They were very surprised and delighted to get their own books since they had been using my copy for years. Best field guides, in my opinion.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this series. We are working on building our collection of Audubon books!

customer_reviews.title: A good reference
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my Peterson's field guide, which I could not find. I like the Peterson Guide better. It is easier to find what you want in the Peterson Guide. The NAS guide is good reference material on reptiles. It may grow on me. I did find my Peterson's guide and will still got to it first.

customer_reviews.title: Good for Identifying the Good from the Bad
customer_reviews.text: bought this to id good and bad reptiles in our area. very good photos and descriptions, nice size, good feel. AND I don't have to log-in anywhere to use it!

customer_reviews.text: Very few of the amphibian guide books include snakes. This one does and gives a good photo representation of all the critters examined. For anyone in the outdoors it will give hours of enjoyment even in your backyard.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Great reference for identification of snakes and other reptiles. Handy size, good pictures in color, salient facts. Just what I needed.

customer_reviews.text: Audubon helps me see how our world is endlessly fascinating--and beautiful. All ages will find this book fascinating. It's a treasure.

customer_reviews.title: ... (I bought 5 different ones) are jam packed with great info, but
customer_reviews.text: These guides (I bought 5 different ones) are jam packed with great info, but...they are way to big and heavy to be considered a field guide in my opinion. It's more of a field encyclopedia. We will keep these at home as reference and keep searching for more light weight field guides to take on our nature walks.

customer_reviews.title: Reptile handbook very useful
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th Audobon guide we've bought. The photographs are definitive, the written material is exhaustive, the information is invaluable, as we live in the country and come across snakes all the time -- and we don't want to kill anything that won't kill us, so we needed a manual. I recommend this book (and the series). Includes turtles, lizards, frogs, etc.
